definition: to make known/to show/to prove/to write/book/outstanding

sentences.english: Mandarin "is the earliest Chinese a kingdom and texts."
sentences.chinese: 国语》是中国最早的一部国野史巨著。

sentences.english: Dream of Red Mansions" is a masterwork."
His great book has added luster to his department and has drawn in students.
sentences.chinese: 他的巨著给他的系增了光并且吸引了更多的学生。

sentences.english: You're too superficial to appreciate great literature like this.
sentences.chinese: 你没有钻劲，无法欣赏这类文学巨著。

sentences.english: This magnum opus took ten years to complete.
sentences.chinese: 这部巨著历时十年方始告成。

sentences.english: Fates and Furies' review: A masterful tale of marriage and secrets.
sentences.chinese: 这是一部关于婚姻和秘密的史诗巨著。

sentences.english: The Lord of the Rings, a three volume fantasy adventure epic authored by J. R.
sentences.chinese: 《魔戒》，三卷奇幻史诗巨著，作者是享有盛誉的J。

sentences.english: This 80-volume, 125-book Chinese-language undertaking was completed in 2004.
sentences.chinese: 这一80卷，125本的汉语巨著完成于2004年。

sentences.english: However, " Zhouyi " who is the author of monumental work of this brilliant brilliant?
sentences.chinese: 然而，《周易》这部煌煌巨著的作者是谁呢？

sentences.english: "A General Reflection for Political Administration" is a magnum opus in Chinese historiography.
sentences.chinese: 《资治通鉴》是中国史学上的一部鸿篇巨著。

sentences.english: The Republic is a very perplexing book, you will find out.
sentences.chinese: 理想国》是本费解的巨著，你会慢慢了解到。

sentences.english: Haiguotuzhi is a great geographical and historical monumental work in the late Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《海国图志》是晚清一部不朽的史地巨著。

sentences.english: His latest offering is a magnum opus on philosophy.
sentences.chinese: 他的最新作品是一部关于哲学的巨著。

definition: a huge amount (of books and papers)
entire book/unabridged book/entire multi-volume work/comprehensive volume
narrative history/comprehensive history/a history covering an extended period
a series of books/a collection of books
"A Brief History of Time" by Stephen Hawking
